description: Number of distinct resistances possible for n resistors with resistances 1, 2, ..., n, each connected in series or parallel to the previous one.
comments: For n = 4, there would be an additional 4 possible values if circuits were allowed that combine complex subcircuits in series or parallel, rather than requiring that one of them consists of a single resistor. See illustration in links. - _Kival Ngaokrajang_, Aug 22 2013 (rephrased by _Dave R.M. Langers_, Nov 13 2013)
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Resistor Network.
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
